SENT.plain: Germline p53 mutations are associated with Li-Fraumeni syndrome (LFS) and other familial cancer phenotypes not fulfilling the definition for LFS
The majority of germline p53 mutations cluster in exons 5-8, corresponding to a DNA binding domain
We report the identification of two germline mutations and a somatic mutation in a tetramerization domain (TD), a rare site for mutations
The germline mutation, R342X (16915C>T), and the novel mutation, R342P (16916G>C), were found in a child with adrenocortical carcinoma and in a LFS pediatric patient with multiple primaries
The novel somatic mutation, R337G (16900C>G), was discovered in myelodysplastic syndrome with transformation to acute myeloblastic leukemia, developing as the third primary in the LFS child
These findings add further information on p53 TD mutations and TD contribution to tumorigenesis
